intro: Epiblastus seranicus, commonly known as the Seranic epiblast, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit and small, opposite leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Epiblastus seranicus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing on trees or other vegetation as an epiphyte. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of epiphytic flora.
